programme.title: Weird Or What? With William Shatner

programme.title: Weird Or What?...

programme.title: The Unxplained With William Shatner

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Series following life in a huge Detroit pawn shop. Les tells a frightening story of a stick-up at his grandpa's store, and a dominatrix brings her gear into the shop.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Crazy Cash: The Detroit family pawn shop opens its doors on dodgy sellers, angry dealers, staff rifts and everything from a gynaecologist's table to an elephant's skull. (S2, ep 1)

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: The Big Bet: Series following a Detroit pawn shop owner and his family as they buy and sell items to family, employees and regular customers. (S2, ep 2)

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Skulls & Scoundrels: The Golds' good reputation is at stake, when a customer claims he was sold a fake watch, and Ashley offers a customer way over the odds for some gemstones. (S2, ep 5)

programme.desc: Best Of: Pick, Trick, or Treat: Mike and Frank are in for a frightening time as they set to work unmasking a range of creepy collections.

programme.desc: Allegro/Ice Cream Van: Derek journeys to Essex to collect Pete Wood's Austin Allegro, which has been sitting in an aircraft hangar at Audley End for 20 years.

programme.title: One Foot in the Grave
programme.desc: The Return of the Speckled Band: Richard Wilson is the disaster-prone Mr Meldrew in this classic sitcom. The Meldrews' plans for a Greek holiday are distracted by a string of events.

programme.title: One Foot in the Grave
programme.desc: In Luton Airport No-One Can Hear You Scream: The Meldrews return from a disastrous Greek holiday to discover that their home has burnt down. Six months later, their new home is ready.

programme.title: One Foot in the Grave
programme.desc: We Have Put Her Living in the Tomb: A classic episode of solid gold comedy. Amid their decorating, Victor and Margaret are entrusted with the care of Kylie the tortoise for a week.

programme.title: The Fred Dibnah Story
programme.desc: Beginnings: The life of the Bolton steeplejack, explaining how his TV career began. This episode sees him working on the spectacular demolition that would set him on the road to fame. Ep1

programme.title: The Fred Dibnah Story
programme.desc: A Sort of Fame: Fred Dibnah gets his first taste of fame, but does not entirely welcome the limelight when it interrupts his work on the restoration of a wrecked steam tractor. Ep2

programme.title: The Fred Dibnah Story
programme.desc: Departures: Fred Dibnah and his wife Alison solve the problem of where to go on holiday by visiting separate locations - she flies off to Greece, while he attends a steam rally. Ep3

programme.title: The Fred Dibnah Story
programme.desc: Alone: Fred Dibnah finds himself being pursued by women, but prefers to concentrate on his work - a felling job that is the most dangerous in his career to date. Ep4

programme.title: Fred Dibnah's Industrial Age
programme.desc: Railways: Fred Dibnah visits the North East to explore the development of Britain's railways, from the first steam locomotives to the record-breaking Mallard.

programme.title: Fred Dibnah's Industrial Age
programme.desc: Ships and Engineering: Fred Dibnah recalls the golden age of shipbuilding, examining the skills of engineers who made Britain one of the leading manufacturing nations.

programme.title: Fred Dibnah's Age of Steam
programme.desc: The Early Pioneers: Fred Dibnah traces the development of steam power from the earliest experiments in the ancient world to the modern nuclear power station.

programme.title: Fred Dibnah's Age of Steam
programme.desc: The Age of the Steam Locomotive: Fred Dibnah tells the story of steam trains, from the earliest colliery railways to the 1960s.

programme.desc: Cortina 2000E/Daimler V250: Nothing screams 1970s more than a Mk3 Ford Cortina 2000E. Derek Mathewson heads to Brigg to value a 1974 example with classic Coke bottle styling and a Pinto engine.

programme.desc: Bentley S3/BSA 3-wheeler: Derek heads to Suffolk to collect two Bentleys with a majestic pedigree; Cynthia a stunning 1963 S3 and Harry, a 1965 Continental.

programme.desc: Dodge Bus/VX2300 Police Car: Dave heads to West Yorkshire for a 1926 Dodge bus. Derek gets his hands on a rare Vauxhall Victor VX 90 police car expected to sell for more than a few coppers.

programme.desc: Plymouth to Porthcurno: Crossing into Cornwall, Michael Portillo learns about the last bridge to be built by renowned engineer Isambard Kingdom Brunel.

programme.title: War Factories
programme.desc: US Aviation: Henry Ford's plan, with the help of Albert Kahn, to build a giant factory in Michigan, covering 3.5million sq ft and including an aircraft production line half a mile in length.
